title: Embedded Systems Leadership Education: Constructivist Practice-Centered Short-Term Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of digital systems and project management experience
context.additional_context: A program combining foundational embedded systems knowledge with practical application skills for corporate social sector managers/leaders, blending hands-on practice with theoretical learning in a digital device-provided environment.

learning_goals: Learners can implement one prototype solving real-world social issues using embedded system components (sensors, processors, actuators).
Learners can lead team-based problem-solving processes for hardware-software integration design and share knowledge with peers using a constructivist approach.
Learners can achieve over 80% of their learning progress through formative assessments (project mid-checks, peer evaluations, self-reflection journals).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
